meanings.definition: To purchase something for less than its actual value.
meanings.sent1: She always underbuys items at the thrift store.
meanings.sent2: He underbuys stocks when they are on sale.
meanings.sent3: The savvy shopper underbuys the designer bag at a garage sale.
meanings.sent4: He underbuys opportunities, missing out on great deals.
meanings.sent5: Underbuying can sometimes lead to missing out on quality products.

meanings.definition: To buy something at a price lower than the market value.
meanings.sent1: The investor underbuys properties in up-and-coming neighborhoods.
meanings.sent2: She underbuys fruits and vegetables at the local market.
meanings.sent3: The bargain hunter underbuys the antique vase at the auction.
meanings.sent4: He underbuys goods, always looking for the best deals.
meanings.sent5: Underbuying can be a smart strategy for saving money.
